intro: Chondrilla phaeocephala, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow, globular flower heads that resemble small globes, which are typically composed of numerous small, clustered petals. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions, and its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green in color. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Chondrilla phaeocephala is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
